messages.title: Stop Brexit and Build a Brighter Future
messages.content: On 12th December voters will have the chance to change our country's future by voting for Meera Chadha, their Liberal Democrat candidate for Walthamstow. Meera works in fostering early years’ support in schools and has dedicated her life to public service. She lives in Waltham Forest with her husband and young daughter.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need to stop Brexit so we can create the huge issues of climate change and creating an economy that works for everyone.
A Liberal Democrat government will raise the energy efficiency standards for new homes, as well as investing £15 billion over the next Parliament to retrofit 26 million homes.

issues.brexitEurope: We can see clearly now that the real consequences of Brexit will be this: It will hit the poorest, it will take away opportunities for our children, and it will isolate our country.
issues.environment: Our planet is on the brink of being irreparably damaged and we are responsible for that damage. The climate emergency is real and our planet is heating to unsustainable levels.

leaflet.personalStatement: My priority is not just to stop Brexit, but to heal the division and acrid economic divide that caused Brexit in the first place.

endorsements.endorsement: We need to stop Brexit so we can create the huge issues of climate change and creating an economy that works for everyone.

quotes.text: It doesn’t matter whether it’s a Labour Brexit or a Conservative Brexit, both would be a disaster for Britain.

images.caption: Find out more about Meera’s work at facebook.com/meerachadhaLD

examples: The Lib Dems will raise energy efficiency standards for new homes, saving the average household £550 a year on energy bills.
My priority is not just to stop Brexit, but to heal the division and acrid economic divide that caused Brexit in the first place.
Our planet is on the brink of being irreparably damaged and we are responsible for that damage.
The Liberal Democrats have ambitious plans to tackle the climate emergency by generating 80% of electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulating all low-income homes by 2025.
We need to stop Brexit so we can create the huge issues of climate change and creating an economy that works for everyone.
We can see clearly now that the real consequences of Brexit will be this: It will hit the poorest, it will take away opportunities for our children, and it will isolate our country.
